title: Information Technology Career Field: Information Technology
subject: CTE

5A8FA547489541FE9CA8F3EAB1E919B3.description: Emerging Technologies: Identify trending technologies, their fundamental architecture, and their value in the marketplace.

4A7E958D4C1545BB9E7DE57B232865FB.description: Identify and apply Transmission Control Protocol and Internet Protocol (TCP/IP), Internet Protocol Version 4 (IPv4), Internet Protocol Version 6 (IPv6) applications and services (e.g., rlogin, Simple Mail Transfer Protocol [SMTP], Telecommunications Network [Telnet], File Transfer Protocol [FTP], Domain Name System [DNS], Network File System [NFS], Voice over Internet Protocol [VoIP], Internet Control Message Protocol [ICMP]).

A479ED3699EE40DCBA22C26B02F224E1.description: Differentiate between the Internet, intranets, and extranets.

E80E769572E646139CB1264D51BA5862.description: Select network storage techniques (e.g., fiber channel, Internet Small Computer System Interface [iSCSI], Fiber Channel over Ethernet [FCoE], Serial Attached SCSI [SAS], Network File Systems [NFS], Network Attached Storage/Server Message Blocks [NAS/SMB]).

9B3C0429F0524139AA2824A839E4AAFA.description: Select the basic point-to-point (PTP) and point-to-multipoint (PTMP) network topologies (e.g., star, ring, tree, network, mesh, irregular) and broadband and baseband transmission methods.

A3EFCFE5710B46C989C5379DEDFDFF6E.description: Differentiate between Local Area Networks (LANs), Wide Area Networks (WANs), Wireless Local Area Networks (WLANs), and Near Field Communication (NFC).

E12BE0B31083476B845B34BCBE18D53C.description: Describe privacy security compliance on systems (e.g., Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act [HIPAA], Payment Card Industry [PCI], Sarbanes Oxley Act [SOX], Americans with Disabilities Act [ADA], General Data Protection Regulation [GDPR], European Union Data Protection Regulation [EUDPR]).

627C1CA9F06F4B83AF58AE34EAD97CB5.description: Practice information security per job requirements.

F004E24578654EED857C165BAF531FDB.description: Identify the need for personal security in digital information and describe how personal information can be safeguarded.

B96CAD4575D1476D80D75CB8CA8E8CFD.description: Describe computer forensics, its importance in information security and cybersecurity, and its relevance to law enforcement.

33CFEC23517D456CA73519A556D9860F.description: Describe the need for security in application development.

4DB0443E9FB34070A31BEFB25369F224.description: Describe the need for security in networking (e.g., firewall, access controls, encryption, demilitarized zone).

583BC0F457E64EB6A556B556F9D31639.description: Describe the components of the physical environment (e.g., wiring closets, server rooms) and physical security systems.

77447EC557034614B3974AFEECB50D16.description: Describe major threats to computer systems (e.g., insider threats, viruses, worms, spyware, ransomware, spoofing, hacking, social engineering, phishing).

5BE35D6019B7426D9C1094ADEA6121D6.description: Identify security risks and describe associated safeguards and methodologies (e.g., auditing).

D116644CBCB346688609BCFE1054BB07.description: Explain the need for confidentiality, integrity, and availability (CIA) of information.

188D37B7F08A41FC91050A23314AEFB9.description: Security, Risks, and Safeguards: Describe the need for security and explain security risks and security safeguards.

13B796AB7AF0439CAB8671522B1830A8.description: IT Fundamentals: Learners apply fundamental principles of IT, including the history of IT and its impact on society, common industry terms, systems theory, information storage and retrieval, database management, and computer hardware, software, and peripheral device configuration and installation. This base of knowledge and skills may be applied across the career field.

42764755EC9D4D028448FA1E9F9BFB7E.description: Use electronic media to communicate and follow network etiquette guidelines.

8265B9A647E74823B2292C4546751BF7.description: Use personal information management and productivity applications to optimize assigned tasks (e.g., lists, calendars, address books).

6694ACDDAF87466199E83DAFF274ED99.description: Use an electronic database to access and create business and technical information.

F74B0BF693AB47D5A7B3560781953C2E.description: Use information technology tools to maintain, secure and monitor business records.

7B206F0810F34DB793303E52C32B8B3B.description: Use system hardware to support software applications.

EAA4611833304E0AB6D86CDED2B51C0A.description: Verify compliance with security rules, regulations and codes (e.g., property, privacy, access, accuracy issues, client and patient record confidentiality) pertaining to technology specific to the industry pathway.

B4F2DBE9E6A24D6892062A059F1A411A.description: Select and use software applications to locate, record, analyze and present information (e.g., word processing, e-mail, spreadsheet, databases, presentation, Internet search engines).

5CA481ED32FC47288DA7125E4A3C6EEB.description: Use office equipment to communicate (e.g., phone, radio equipment, fax machine, scanner, public address systems).

5F640092C1B348429801DFD2A6180793.description: Knowledge Management and Information Technology: Demonstrate current and emerging strategies and technologies used to collect, analyze, record, and share information in business operations.

4390FAB35B404FFCB5019CF7E4249CB7.description: Identify potential conflicts of interest (e.g., personal gain, project bidding) between personal, organizational and professional ethical standards.

C460FBC4FD11424F9260D714613FDBFC.description: Verify compliance with computer and intellectual property laws and regulations.

17741550043A441F967F515494463C47.description: Identify the labor laws that affect employment and the consequences of noncompliance for both employee and employer (e.g., harassment, labor, employment, employment interview, testing, minor labor laws, Americans with Disabilities Act, Fair Labor Standards Acts, Equal Employment Opportunity Commission [EEOC]).

DF0DC541623742419AF9E71413397D76.description: Identify deceptive practices (e.g., bait and switch, identity theft, unlawful door-to-door sales, deceptive service estimates, fraudulent misrepresentations) and their overall impact on organizational performance.

47A8871FA2EF437D9C9F87BAE5EAE481.description: Access and implement safety compliance measures (e.g., quality assurance information, safety data sheets [SDSs], product safety data sheets [PSDSs], United States Environmental Protection Agency [EPA], United States Occupational Safety and Health Administration [OSHA]) that contribute to the continuous improvement of the organization.

D68FC493FE2843CDBCC2125932C6DC6A.description: Identify how federal and state consumer protection laws affect products and services.

C545256252DE46CE99A48FB4615BD0A6.description: Use ethical character traits consistent with workplace standards (e.g., honesty, personal integrity, compassion, justice).

42234B938FF2438EAF66CCE66BF0E1CB.description: Follow protocols and practices necessary to maintain a clean, safe and healthy work environment.

E58DAC7FCF5F4BB7B4855DBC70F7B30C.description: Analyze how regulatory compliance affects business operations and organizational performance.

FB19DE2351D741F1B67A3D706F668B01.description: Business Ethics and Law: Analyze how professional, ethical, and legal behavior contributes to continuous improvement in organizational performance and regulatory compliance.

0AD41450EEA847548719DB1E99E5B1F4.description: Use motivational strategies to accomplish goals.

561952C62D194EE8A9CA5DC75E60D91E.description: Identify stakeholders and solicit their opinions.

DE32E282F6B14791AAD47762443B33CA.description: Use technical writing skills to complete forms and create reports.

C546F2BA40B14F1BBDB326F96707801A.description: Identify advantages and disadvantages involving digital and/or electronic communications (e.g., common content for large audience, control of tone, speed, cost, lack of non-verbal cues, potential for forwarding information, longevity).

CA6EDA125CD34E05A1F2A09CA8D2552F.description: Identify the strengths, weaknesses, and characteristics of leadership styles that influence internal and external workplace relationships.

DD73D1066FC0473E8D69E7831A98E5A7.description: Use problem-solving and consensus-building techniques to draw conclusions and determine next steps.

E062BFDCB6C041EB95F3A9D68CEE8786.description: Use proper grammar and expression in all aspects of communication.

A8A98A52B16A4A6284ACC43DE0B5A1CA.description: Communicate information (e.g., directions, ideas, vision, workplace expectations) for an intended audience and purpose.

7C6BBABDAA4F4ABD9E32FEF3AE480D0F.description: Use negotiation and conflict-resolution skills to reach solutions.

C64312D50DE748DB903AE632782AE582.description: Identify and use verbal, nonverbal and active listening skills to communicate effectively.

E938ED557589414189E29A1D4027F799.description: Extract relevant, valid information from materials and cite sources of information.

B826056394B24924A4464F4A10FA730C.description: Leadership and Communication: Develop career awareness and employability skills (e.g., face-to-face, online) needed for gaining and maintaining employment in diverse business settings.

8F4571A6C73F4D9F86F54966DB85A40B.description: Identify healthy lifestyles that reduce the risk of chronic disease, unsafe habits and abusive behavior.

3DDB5F6FC9C54611BED0199E5CB0A81B.description: Recognize different cultural beliefs and practices in the workplace and demonstrate respect for them.

5C08A3C07DCB43B7968E754E4A97716D.description: Adapt personal coping skills to adjust to taxing workplace demands.

DBDF057DFC424FE9A7CC41CE8FAC6E2C.description: Give and receive constructive feedback to improve work habits.

16E3F81BE2854D4FAA9A378BB068C8AF.description: Identify the correlation between emotions, behavior and appearance and manage those to establish and maintain professionalism.

81E951271D844FDFA875142148C47B31.description: Apply problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to work-related issues when making decisions and formulating solutions.

0D108987B0E04B88B97E8CFE97836B0A.description: Explain the importance of work ethic, accountability and responsibility and demonstrate associated behaviors in fulfilling personal, community and workplace roles.

A0397F107AE547C7A70A169D9444E3F5.description: Develop strategies for self-promotion in the hiring process (e.g., filling out job applications, resume writing, interviewing skills, portfolio development).

239A45DC6471444EA3BF6F7F16A43A73.description: Describe the role and function of professional organizations, industry associations and organized labor and use networking techniques to develop and maintain professional relationships.

2C19F781C53C4DC4B3B25C706C1C73DF.description: Develop a career plan that reflects career interests, pathways and secondary and postsecondary options.

1E842F4D1815453CBFEAAD6E7EA7A35E.description: Identify the scope of career opportunities and the requirements for education, training, certification, licensure and experience.

C291809EF4AD4C8182F4052DF53BEEFF.description: Identify the knowledge, skills and abilities necessary to succeed in careers.

9DB70672F5A94D3EA93742481D435A5E.description: Employability Skills: Develop career awareness and employability skills (e.g., face-to-face, online) needed for gaining and maintaining employment in diverse business settings.

44ECB83B5C374067AB0D2938B3C36168.description: Business Operations/21st Century Skills: Learners apply principles of economics, business management, marketing, and employability in an entrepreneur, manager, and employee role to the leadership, planning, developing, and analyzing of business enterprises related to the career field.
